body.name: Her Earl's Promise: A Historical Regency Romance Novel
body.description: “Love only leads to heartbreak. I will never let that happen to me.”Lady Alicia is determined to remain a spinster. Even if that means staying away from a most intriguing Earl...Oscar, the Earl of Suffolk never backs down from a challenge. So, when free-spirited Alicia comes into his life, he swears he will do anything to win her heart.But changing a fiery spinster's mind is not an easy feat, and it will take much more than Oscar ever imagined to make her his...*If you like a realistic yet charming depiction of the Regency and Victorian era, then Her Earl's Promise is the novel for you.An enchanting regency romance of 60,000 words (around 300 pages), written by Hanna Hamilton and published by Cobalt Fairy.No cheating, no cliffhangers, and a sweet happily ever after.Pick up "Her Earl's Promise" today to discover Hanna's amazing new story!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beware of Those Close
reviews.reviewText: Lady Alicia is different the other ladies of the ton. She loves to garden, is outspoken, and little free spirited. Even though her parents see her differences it does not matter to them as they feel the right gentleman will accept her. Her friend Lady Lily not so much but even though they have their differences they are the best of friends. One night Oscar an Earl seen her and immediately was drawn to this different young woman. Probably the difference was what attracted him as he knew how the other ladies of the ton acted and wasn't impressed. Once he has set his eyes on Alicia, he has decided he will make it his mission to win her heart. There is one problem that will hinder his pursuit of Alicia, and that is her friend Lily. Lily has decided to make Oscar her's. ARC Review

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Alice and Oscar
reviews.reviewText: This plot focuses on characters that are not interested in marriage, and a few that are. Unexpected meetings suddenly causes doubt in those determined to remain single, and jealousy and manipulations develop from those seeking to find their happiness any way possible. Drama, mistrust, and nefarious intentions comes to a head at the ending. The independent, strong-minded characters tend to struggle with trust issues, and thereby lacking faith in others. The author did a great job in creating detailed scenes, well-developed characters, and adding a bit of drama or two to create the necessary conflict. This is a great historical romance, with a bit of sluggish movement in the middle. The title of the story leaves me wondering what the Earl’s promise was? I received a complimentary ARC, but I am voluntarily offering my personal opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Believe in your heart
reviews.reviewText: Excellent book! I loved Alice and Oscar's love story. This book has a gripping story line of two young ladies one lives in the real world surrounded by gardening while the other lives a live in make believe romance. Alice doesn't recognize Oscar's love at first and lets her friend Lily's jealously get in the way because she feels Oscar belongs to her. How can Oscar convince Alice he is not the rake Lily's painted him? When will Alice learn her best friend has betrayed her? You will have to read to find out. Share with your friends, family and book clubs I'm sure they will love this book also. Enjoy!🍷

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This story begins by sharing a childhood friendship between Alice and Lily. It then progresses on to their season, during which time Alice meets Oscar. How do they meet and what happens when someone close to them tries to cause doubts? Read how all this is overcome and they find their hea. On a personal note I was confused at times at some of the descriptions/dialogue/thoughts involving the various characters. Perhaps overly done or something? I just kind of got lost in all of it. It may have been just me….overall a sweet read

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Well written, starts off slow but the further into the book you are to keep on track better. Full of drama, love, emotions, suspense, society and a great cover. The characters had some confusion about them , some strong some not. Alicia is different from most ladies of the ton as she likes to garden, likes to speak her mind, not holding anything back and she doesn't fuss over her gowns or hair. Her friend, Lily, is one of these girls. Looking for a rich husband this season. Oscar is an Earl who Lily wants but he wants Alicia. Lily tries as hard to be noticed by Oscar hoping to win her. Has some blocks before Alicia and Oscar get their happily ever after. Would recommend to others.I am an ARC and leave this unbiased, honest review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finding the one
reviews.reviewText: This was a storyline of a young woman having her first season. She meets a young man and he’s smitten! Now he sets out to win her but others try and make trouble! I voluntarily reviewed an Advance Reader Copy of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars So drawn out.
reviews.reviewText: And so very predictable. Loads of talk about nothing. Very boring. Sorry just not for me. Best part is the cover.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Her Earl's Promise
reviews.reviewText: I liked this book but I was confused in the beginning with the 2 girls. They were mixed up in my mind and it took a while to figure it out. I have not read the epilogue yet but I will as soon as I can find it. I gave this book a four star because the editing was horrible. Names were changed and reversed. Alice's parents were called the Suffolk's and then reversed when Oscar's mom was introduced. I would recommend this book if you don't mind the mistakes. I love Hanna's writing but she needs a new editor.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: A Good Story but with Errors
reviews.reviewText: I quite enjoyed the plot of this story but there were confusing errors. The names of the characters sometimes changed e.g. Alice was called Alicia twice in the introduction, she was later addressed as Lady Cornwall instead of Lady Alice. Her parents were addressed as Lord/Lady Suffolk when they were actually Lord/Lady Cornwall. It made it difficult to follow at times. I appreciated the interest Alice had in plants and botany. I also admired Oscar's determination in pursuing Alice. I felt that Oscar's mother's grief was understandable but would have liked to read that she became more settled by the end of the story. She was mentioned in the extended epilogue though. Lily's jealousy was cruel but was resolved in the end. There were good points in the story and it will be improved when the errors are corrected.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Good Plot with discussions of friendship
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed the plot but found the narrative very confusing, I found Myself lost as to which girl Alice or Lily was speaking. There were also errors which didn't help.
